text: Shark Island is a small rocky islet, located northeast of Prettyklip Point on Saint Thomas in the United States Virgin Islands. Its elevation is 32 feet.Griffes, Peter L. (2004). 2004 Atlantic Boating Almanac: Gulf of Mexico. ProStar Publications. Page 529. . It is a colony for numerous species of seabirds,Evans, Peter G. H. (1990). Birds of the Eastern Caribbean. Macmillan Education. Page 138. . and is also a popular scuba-diving destination in the USVI.Sullivan, George (1969). The Complete Book of Skin and Scuba Diving. Coward-McCann. Page 208. == References == Category:Uninhabited islands of the United States Virgin Islands Category:East End, Saint Thomas, U.S. Virgin Islands
title: Shark Island, United States Virgin Islands
